info.title: Checkout API
info.description: Endpoints that deal with to shopping cart management and order placement.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

post.description:
This endpoint is used to simulate a cart in VTEX Checkout.

It receives an **SKU ID**, the **quantity** of items in the cart, the ID of the **Seller** and the **country** in ISO ALPHA-3 Code (eg. BRA, USA, ARG).

It sends back all information about the cart, such as the selling price of each item, rates and benefits data, payment and logistics info.

This is useful whenever you need to know the availability of fulfilling an order for a specific cart setting, since the API response will let you know the updated price, inventory and shipping data.

**Important**: The fields `sku id`, `quantity`, `seller` and `country` are just examples of content that you can simulate in your cart. You can add more fields to the request as per your need. Access the [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) guide to check the available fields.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: RnbBehavior
parameters.description:
This parameter defines which promotions apply to the simulation. Use `1` for simulations at cart stage, which means all promotions apply. In case of window simulation use `0`, which indicates promotions that apply nominal discounts over the total purchase value shouldn't be considered on the simulation.

Note that if this not sent, the parameter is `0`.

parameters.name: sc
parameters.description: Trade Policy (Sales Channel) identification.

items.description: Array containing information about the SKUs inside the cart to be simulated.

quantity.description: The quantity of items of this specific SKU in the cart to be simulated.

seller.description: The ID of the seller responsible for this SKU. This ID can be found in your VTEX Admin.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

items.description: Information on each item in the cart.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item the cart.

seller.description: The seller responsible for the SKU.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

items.description: Seller.

sellingPrice.description: Selling price in cents. Note that this field may be subject to rounding discrepancies. We recommend retrieving data from the `priceDefinition` data structure instead.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

priceDefinition.description: Price information for all units of a specific item.

calculatedSellingPrice.description: Item's calculated unitary selling price in cents.

total.description: Total value for all units of the item in cents.

sellingPrices.description: Array of objects, each containing value (in cents) and quantity for the different rounding instances that can be combined to form the correctly rounded total.

value.description: Value in cents for that specific rounding.

quantity.description: Rounding quantity, meaning how many items are rounded to this value.

ratesAndBenefitsData.description: Information on rates and benefits that apply to the order.

rateAndBenefitsIdentifiers.description: List with rates and benefits identifiers.

teaser.description: List with rates and benefits teasers.

value.description: Total value assigned to this payment.

hasInterestRate.description: Indicates whether the payment has interest.

value.description: Value of the order without the interest rate. The value is shown without separating cents.

total.description: Total value of the order without separating cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

requiresDocument.description: Indicates whether a document is required.

displayDocument.description: Indicates whether a document is shown.

requiresAuthentication.description: Indicates whether a authentication is required.

giftCards.description: Gift card information, if it applies to the order.

selectableGifts.description: Array containing the data of the item selected as a gift.

marketingData.description: Object containing promotion data such as coupon tracking information and internal or external UTMs.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

logisticsInfo.description: Array with logistics information on each item of the `items` array in the `orderForm`.

itemIndex.description: Index of item in items array.

selectedDeliveryChannel.description: Delivery channel selected by the customer. For example, `"delivery"` or `"pickup-in-point"`.

shipsTo.description: List of countries that the item may be shipped to.

messages.description: Array containing an object for each message generated by our servers while processing the request.

itemPurchaseConditions.description: List of objects containing purchase condition information on each item in the order.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

value.description: Total value.

items.description: List of objects containing metadata on each item in the order.

required.description: Indicates whether the item is required.

get.summary: Get current cart or create a new one
get.description:
This request allows you to obtain information of an existing shopping cart or to create a new empty one. VTEX checkout provides browsers with a cookie containing an `orderFormId`. Sending this request with such a cookie retrieves information of the cart corresponding to that ID. Without the cookie, this request creates and retrieves a new shopping cart.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` obtained in response is the identification code of the newly created cart.

> This request has a time out of 45 seconds.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description:
Use this request to get all information associated to a given shopping  cart.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

> This request has a time out of 45 seconds.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose information you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: refreshOutdatedData
parameters.description: It is possible to use the [Update cart items request](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/cart-update#itemsupdate) so as to allow outdated information in the `orderForm`, which may improve performance in some cases. To guarantee that all cart information is updated, send this request with this parameter as `true`. We recommend doing this in the final stages of the shopping experience, starting from the checkout page.

post.description:
This request removes all items from a given cart, leaving it empty.

You must send an empty JSON in the body of the request.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose items you want to remove.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description:
This call removes all user information, making a cart anonymous, while leaving the items.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

This call works by creating a new orderForm, setting a new cookie and returning a redirect 302 to the cart URL (`/checkout/#/orderform`).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose user's personal data you want to remove.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose items you want to update.

parameters.name: allowedOutdatedData
parameters.description:
In order to optimize performance, this parameter allows some information to not be updated when there are changes in the minicart. For instance, if a shopper adds another unit of a given SKU to the cart, it may not be necessary to recalculate payment information, which could impact performance.

This array accepts strings and currently the only possible value is `paymentData`.

orderItems.description: Array containing the cart items. Each object inside this array corresponds to a different item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item the cart.

seller.description: The seller responsible for the SKU.

id.description: The ID of the SKU in VTEX platform.

index.description: The position of the item in the array.

price.description: Price of the item in cents. Send this value in case you want to make a bulk price change.

orderFormId.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to a specific cart.

salesChannel.description: Attribute created by the seller, in their VTEX store configuration.

loggedIn.description: Indicates whether the user is logged into the store.

isCheckedIn.description: Indicates whether order is checked in.

allowManualPrice.description: Permission to modify item price manually.

userProfileId.description: Unique ID associated with the customer profile.

addressType.description: Address type.

country.description: Country of the address. ISO three-letter code.

number.description: Number of the address.

complement.description: Complement to the address.

reference.description: Reference that may help in the location of the address.

geoCoordinates.description: List with the two geocoordinates.

value.description: Total value of the order without separating cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

messages.description: Array containing an object for each message generated by our servers while processing the request.

items.description: Information on each item in the order.

manualPriceAppliedBy.description: User that applied the manual price, if that is the case.

sellingPrice.description: Selling price in cents. Note that this field may be subject to rounding discrepancies. We recommend retrieving data from the `priceDefinition` data structure instead.

isGift.description: Indicates whether item is a gift.

productCategories.description: Object, where each field is an ID from `productCategoryIds`.

{ID}.description: Product category corresponding to the ID in the field key.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

items.description: Seller.

bundleItems.description: Information on services sold along with the SKU. Example: a gift package.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

isPercentual.description: Indicates whether price tag value is applied through a percentage.

value.description: Price tag value.

priceDefinition.description: Price information for all units of a specific item.

calculatedSellingPrice.description: Item's calculated unitary selling price in cents.

total.description: Total value for all units of the item in cents.

sellingPrices.description: Array of objects, each containing value (in cents) and quantity for the different rounding instances that can be combined to form the correctly rounded total.

value.description: Value in cents for that specific rounding.

quantity.description: Rounding quantity, meaning how many items are rounded to this value.

selectableGifts.description: Array containing the data of the item selected as a gift.

totalizers.description: Array containing an object for each totalizer for the purchase. Totalizers contain the sum of values for a specific part of the order (e.g. Total item value, Total shipping value).

shippingData.description: Shipping information pertinent to the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

logisticsInfo.description: Array with logistics information. Each object in this array corresponds to an object in the `items` array, based on the respective `itemIndex`.

itemIndex.description: Index corresponding to the position of the object in the `items` array.

selectedDeliveryChannel.description: Delivery channel selected by the customer.

shippingEstimate.description: Shipping estimate. For instance, Three business days will be represented `3bd`.

isPickupStore.description: Indicates whether it is the pickup store.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

transitTime.description: Transit time. For instance, "three business days" is represented `3bd`.

shipsTo.description: List of countries that the item may be shipped to.

items.description: Three letter country code.

selectedAddresses.description: Array with information on the selected addresses for the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

availableAddresses.description: Array with information on the available addresses for the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

documentType.description: Type of the document informed by the customer.

corporateName.description: Company name, if the customer is a legal entity.

tradeName.description: Trade name, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporateDocument.description: Corporate document, if the customer is a legal entity.

stateInscription.description: State inscription, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporatePhone.description: Corporate phone number, if the customer is a legal entity.

isCorporate.description: Indicates whether the customer is a legal entity.

profileCompleteOnLoading.description: Indicates whether profile is complete on loading.

profileErrorOnLoading.description: Indicates whether profile presents error on loading.

giftCards.description: Gift card information, if it applies to the order.

value.description: Gift card value in cents.

inUse.description: Indicates whether gift card is in use.

isSpecialCard.description: Indicates whether gift card is special.

transactions.description: Information on each transaction pertinent to the order.

referenceValue.description: Reference value for calculating interest rates, in case it applies. Displayed in cents.

value.description: Value including interest, in case it applies. Displayed in cents.

marketingData.description: Object containing promotion data such as coupon tracking information and internal or external UTMs.

coupon.description: Sending an existing coupon code in this field will return the corresponding discount in the purchase. Use the [cart simulation](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/orderform#orderformsimulation) request to check which coupons might apply before placing the order.

clientPreferencesData.description: Object containing preferences from the client who placed the order.

optinNewsLetter.description: `true` if the client opted to receive newsletter from the store.

storePreferencesData.description: Object containing data from the store's configuration (stored in VTEX's License Manager).

openTextField.description: Optional field meant to hold additional information about the order. We recommend using this field for text, not data formats such as `JSON` even if escaped. For that purpose, see [Creating customizable fields](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/creating-customizable-fields-in-the-cart-with-checkout-api-1).

invoiceData.description: Object containing information pertinent to the order's invoice.

items.description: List of objects containing metadata on each item in the order.

ratesAndBenefitsData.description: Information on rates and benefits that apply to the order.

rateAndBenefitsIdentifiers.description: List with rates and benefits identifiers.

teaser.description: List with rates and benefits teasers.

itemsOrdination.description: Object containing information about the ordering of items within the orderForm.

criteria.description: Criteria adopted to order the items in the list.

ascending.description: Indicates whether the ordering is ascending.

put.description:
This request changes the price of an SKU in a cart. You can also perform type of bulk price change with the [Update cart items request](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/shopping-cart#itemsupdate)

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

You need to inform which cart you are referring to, by sending its `orderFormId`; and what is the item whose price you want to change, by sending its `itemIndex`.

You also need to pass the new price value in the body.

Remember that, to use this endpoint, the feature of *manual price* must be active. To check if it's active, use the [Get orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#getorderformconfiguration) endpoint. To make it active, use the [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#updateorderformconfiguration) endpoint, making the `allowManualPrice` field `true`.

> Whenever you use this request to change the price of an item, all items in that cart with the same SKU are affected by this change. This applies even to items that share the SKU but have been separated into different objects in the `items` array due to customizations or attachments, for example.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose items will have the price changed.

parameters.name: itemIndex
parameters.description: The index of the item in the cart. Each cart item is identified by an index, starting in 0.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

patch.description:
When a shopper provides an email address at Checkout, the platform tries to retrieve existing profile information for that email and add it to the shopping cart information. Use this request if you want to change this behavior for a given cart, meaning profile information will not be included in the order automattically.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

Note that this request will only work if you have not sent the `clientProfileData` to the cart yet. Sending it to a cart that already has a `clientProfileData` should return a status `403 Forbidden` error, with an `Access denied` message.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose items will have the price changed.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

ignoreProfileData.description: Indicates whether profile data should be ignored.

get.description:
Retrieve a client's profile information by providing an email address.

If the response fields are empty, it means that there is no client registered with that email address in your store.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Client's email address to be searched.

userProfileId.description: Unique ID associated with the customer profile.

addressType.description: Address type.

country.description: Country of the address. ISO three-letter code.

number.description: Number of the address.

complement.description: Complement to the address.

reference.description: Reference that may help in the location of the address.

geoCoordinates.description: List with the two geocoordinates.

corporateName.description: Name of the company. Used for corporate clients.

tradeName.description: Trade name. Used for corporate clients.

stateInscription.description: State inscription. Used for corporate clients.

corporatePhone.description: Telephone number. Used for corporate clients.

isComplete.description: Indicates whether customer profile is complete.

post.description:
Use this request to include client profile information to a given shopping cart.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

> This request has a time out of 12 seconds.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive client profile information.

documentType.description: Type of the document informed by the customer.

document.description: Document number informed by the customer.

corporateName.description: Company name, if the customer is a legal entity.

tradeName.description: Trade name, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporateDocument.description: Corporate document, if the customer is a legal entity.

stateInscription.description: State inscription, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporatePhone.description: Corporate phone number, if the customer is a legal entity.

isCorporate.description: `true` if the customer is a legal entity.

post.summary: Add shipping address and select delivery option
post.description:
Use this request to include shipping information and/or selected delivery option to a given shopping cart.

To add shipping addresses send the `selectedAddresses` array. For delivery option use the `logisticsInfo` array.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

> This request has a time out of 12 seconds.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive client profile information.

selectedAddresses.description: List of objects with addresses information.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`, among others.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

logisticsInfo.description: Array with logistics information on each item of the `items` array in the `orderForm`.

itemIndex.description: Index of item in items array

selectedDeliveryChannel.description: Delivery channel selected by the customer. For example, `"delivery"` or `"pickup-in-point"`.

post.description:
Use this request to include client preferences information to a given shopping cart.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

> This request has a time out of 12 seconds.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive client profile information.

locale.description: Locale chosen by the shopper. Determines website language.

optinNewsLetter.description: Indicates whether the shopper opted in to receive the store's news letter.

post.description:
Use this request to include marketing information to a given shopping cart.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

> This request has a time out of 12 seconds.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive client profile information.

coupon.description: Sending an existing coupon code in this field will return the corresponding discount in the purchase. Use the [cart simulation](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/orderform#orderformsimulation) request to check which coupons might apply before placing the order.

post.description:
Use this request to include payment information to a given shopping cart. The payment information attachment in the shopping cart does not determine the final order payment method in itself. However, it allows tha platform to update any relevant information that may be impacted by the payment method.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

> This request has a time out of 12 seconds.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive client profile information.

payments.description: Array with information on each payment chosen by the shopper.

value.description: Total value assigned to this payment.

referenceValue.description: Reference value used to calculate total order value with interest.

hasDefaultBillingAddress.description: Indicates whether billing address for this payment is the default address.

post.description:
This endpoint is used for the merchant to add to the cart any relevant information that is related to the context of a specific order.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

> This request has a time out of 12 seconds.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive the relevant information added by the merchant.

salesAssociateId.description: Sales Associate (Seller) identification code. All information should be registered by the merchant. Maximum of 100 characters.

put.description:
Your account may create `apps`, which contain custom fields, through the [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/configuration#updateorderformconfiguration) request. The values of these custom fields can then be updated by this request.

To do that, you need to inform the ID of the app you created with the configuration API (`appId`).

In the body of the request, for each field created in this app (`appFieldName`) you will inform a value (`appFieldValue`).

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive the new custom field values.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: ID of the app created with the configuration API.

schema.description: Here you must add the pairs of Field Name and Field Value.

put.description:
Your account may create `apps`, which contain custom fields, through the [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#updateorderformconfiguration) request. The value of a specific custom field can then be updated by this request.

To do that, you need to inform in the URL the ID of the app you created with the configuration API (`appId`).

In the body of the request, you will inform the new value (`appFieldValue`, passed through the body) of the specific field created in this app (identified by the `appFieldName` parameter, passed through the URL).

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: The ID of the orderForm whose custom field's value you want to change.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: ID of the app created through the Update orderForm Configuration endpoint.

parameters.name: appFieldName
parameters.description: Name of the app's field created through the Update orderForm Configuration endpoint.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

delete.description:
Your account may create `apps`, which contain custom fields, through the [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#updateorderformconfiguration) request. The value of a specific custom field can be removed by this request.

To do that, you need to inform in the URL the ID of the app you created with the configuration API (`appId`).

You also need to iform the specific field created in this app (identified by the `appFieldName` parameter, also passed through the URL) whose value you want to remove.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: The ID of the orderForm from which you want to remove the custom field value.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: ID of the app created through the Update orderForm Configuration endpoint.

parameters.name: appFieldName
parameters.description: Name of the app's field created through the Update orderForm Configuration endpoint and which will be deleted.

get.description:
Retrieves the settings that are currently applied to every orderForm in the account.

These settings are defined by the request [Update orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference/configuration#updateorderformconfiguration).

Always use this request to retrieve the current configuration before performing an update. By doing so you ensure that you are modifying only the properties you want.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

post.description:
Determines settings that will apply to every orderForm in the account.

For example, if you create an app using this request, every orderForm of this account will have the custom fields created though it.

**Important**: always retrieve the current configuration before performing an update to ensure that you are modifying only the properties you want. Otherwise, old values can be overwritten. To retrieve the current configuration, use the request [Get orderForm configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/reference#getorderformconfiguration).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

get.description:
Retrieves a marketplaces window to change seller, that is, the period when it is possible to choose another seller to fulfill a given order after the original seller has canceled it.

The default period for this window is of 2 days, but it can be configured by the request Update window to change seller.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

post.description:
Updates a marketplaces window to change seller, that is, the period when it is possible to choose another seller to fulfill a given order after the original seller has canceled it.

It is possible to check the current window using the request Get window to change seller.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

post.description:
This request removes all messages from the `messages` field of the orderForm , leaving it empty.

You must send an empty JSON in the body of the request.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to the cart whose messages you want to remove.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

orderFormId.description: ID of the orderForm corresponding to a specific cart.

salesChannel.description: Attribute created by the seller, in their VTEX store configuration.

loggedIn.description: Indicates whether the user is logged into the store.

isCheckedIn.description: Indicates whether order is checked in.

allowManualPrice.description: Permission to modify item price manually.

userProfileId.description: Unique ID associated with the customer profile.

addressType.description: Address type.

country.description: Country of the address. ISO three-letter code.

number.description: Number of the address.

complement.description: Complement to the address.

reference.description: Reference that may help in the location of the address.

geoCoordinates.description: List with the two geocoordinates.

value.description: Total value of the order without separating cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

messages.description: Array containing an object for each message generated by our servers while processing the request.

items.description: Information on each item in the order.

manualPriceAppliedBy.description: User that applied the manual price, if that is the case.

sellingPrice.description: Selling price in cents. Note that this field may be subject to rounding discrepancies. We recommend retrieving data from the `priceDefinition` data structure instead.

isGift.description: Indicates whether item is a gift.

productCategories.description: Object, where each field is an ID from `productCategoryIds`.

{ID}.description: Product category corresponding to the ID in the field key.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

items.description: Seller.

bundleItems.description: Information on services sold along with the SKU. Example: a gift package.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

isPercentual.description: Indicates whether price tag value is applied through a percentage.

value.description: Price tag value.

priceDefinition.description: Price information for all units of a specific item.

calculatedSellingPrice.description: Item's calculated unitary selling price in cents.

total.description: Total value for all units of the item in cents.

sellingPrices.description: Array of objects, each containing value (in cents) and quantity for the different rounding instances that can be combined to form the correctly rounded total.

value.description: Value in cents for that specific rounding.

quantity.description: Rounding quantity, meaning how many items are rounded to this value.

selectableGifts.description: Array containing the data of the item selected as a gift.

totalizers.description: Array containing an object for each totalizer for the purchase. Totalizers contain the sum of values for a specific part of the order (e.g. Total item value, Total shipping value).

shippingData.description: Shipping information pertinent to the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

logisticsInfo.description: Array with logistics information. Each object in this array corresponds to an object in the `items` array, based on the respective `itemIndex`.

itemIndex.description: Index corresponding to the position of the object in the `items` array.

selectedDeliveryChannel.description: Delivery channel selected by the customer.

shippingEstimate.description: Shipping estimate. For instance, Three business days will be represented `3bd`.

isPickupStore.description: Indicates whether it is the pickup store.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

transitTime.description: Transit time. For instance, "three business days" is represented `3bd`.

shipsTo.description: List of countries that the item may be shipped to.

items.description: Three letter country code.

selectedAddresses.description: Array with information on the selected addresses for the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

availableAddresses.description: Array with information on the available addresses for the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

documentType.description: Type of the document informed by the customer.

corporateName.description: Company name, if the customer is a legal entity.

tradeName.description: Trade name, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporateDocument.description: Corporate document, if the customer is a legal entity.

stateInscription.description: State inscription, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporatePhone.description: Corporate phone number, if the customer is a legal entity.

isCorporate.description: Indicates whether the customer is a legal entity.

profileCompleteOnLoading.description: Indicates whether profile is complete on loading.

profileErrorOnLoading.description: Indicates whether profile presents error on loading.

giftCards.description: Gift card information, if it applies to the order.

value.description: Gift card value in cents.

inUse.description: Indicates whether gift card is in use.

isSpecialCard.description: Indicates whether gift card is special.

transactions.description: Information on each transaction pertinent to the order.

referenceValue.description: Reference value for calculating interest rates, in case it applies. Displayed in cents.

value.description: Value including interest, in case it applies. Displayed in cents.

marketingData.description: Object containing promotion data such as coupon tracking information and internal or external UTMs.

coupon.description: Sending an existing coupon code in this field will return the corresponding discount in the purchase. Use the [cart simulation](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/orderform#orderformsimulation) request to check which coupons might apply before placing the order.

clientPreferencesData.description: Object containing preferences from the client who placed the order.

optinNewsLetter.description: `true` if the client opted to receive newsletter from the store.

storePreferencesData.description: Object containing data from the store's configuration (stored in VTEX's License Manager).

openTextField.description: Optional field meant to hold additional information about the order. We recommend using this field for text, not data formats such as `JSON` even if escaped. For that purpose, see [Creating customizable fields](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/creating-customizable-fields-in-the-cart-with-checkout-api-1).

invoiceData.description: Object containing information pertinent to the order's invoice.

items.description: List of objects containing metadata on each item in the order.

ratesAndBenefitsData.description: Information on rates and benefits that apply to the order.

rateAndBenefitsIdentifiers.description: List with rates and benefits identifiers.

teaser.description: List with rates and benefits teasers.

itemsOrdination.description: Object containing information about the ordering of items within the orderForm.

criteria.description: Criteria adopted to order the items in the list.

ascending.description: Indicates whether the ordering is ascending.

get.description:
Retrieves possible amount of installments and respective values for a given cart with a given payment method.

The [orderForm](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/checkout-api-overview) is the data structure which represents a shopping cart and contains all information pertaining to it. Hence, the `orderFormId` is the identification code of a given cart.

This endpoint can be used to get the installment options for only one payment method at a time.

This endpoint should be called only after the selected `orderForm` already has a `paymentData`.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the `orderForm` to be consulted for installments.

parameters.name: paymentSystem
parameters.description: ID of the payment method to be consulted for installments.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

post.description: Use this request to add coupons to a given shopping cart.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the orderForm that will receive coupon information.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

couponCode.description: Sending an existing coupon code in this field will return the corresponding discount in the purchase. Use the [cart simulation](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/orderform#orderformsimulation) request to check which coupons might apply before placing the order.

get.description:
Retrieves information on pickup points close to a given location determined by geocoordinates or postal code.

The pickup points returned are not necessarily all active ones. Make sure to validate the information consumed by integrations.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: geoCoordinates
parameters.description: Geocoordinates around which to search for pickup points. If you use this type of search, do not pass postal and country codes.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Postal code around which to search for pickup points. If you use this type of search, make sure to pass a `countryCode` and do not pass `geoCoordinates`.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Three letter country code refering to the `postalCode` field. Pass the country code only if you are searching pickup points by postal code.

get.description:
Retrieves address information for a given postal code and country.

This request can be used to implement auto complete functionality when a customer needs to fill in an address.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: Three letter country code refering to the `postalCode` field.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Postal code.

post.summary: Place order from an existing cart
post.description:
This endpoint places an order from an existing `orderForm` object, meaning an existing cart.

After the creation of an order with this request, you have five minutes to send payment information and then request payment processing.

parameters.name: orderFormId
parameters.description: ID of the `orderForm` corresponding to the cart from which to place the order.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

referenceId.title: referenceId
referenceId.description: ID of the `orderForm` corresponding to the cart from which to place the order. This is the same as the `orderFormId` parameter.

savePersonalData.title: savePersonalData
savePersonalData.description: `true` if the shopper's data provided during checkout should be saved for future reference.

optinNewsLetter.title: optinNewsLetter
optinNewsLetter.description: True if the shopper opted to receive the newsletter.

value.description: Total value of the order without separating cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

referenceValue.description: Reference value of the order for calculating interest if that is the case. Can be equal to the total value and does not separate cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

interestValue.description: Interest rate to be used in case it applies.

put.description: Places order without having any prior cart information. This means all information on items, client, payment and shipping mus be sent in the body.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

items.description: Array of objects containing information on each of the order's items.

quantity.description: The quantity of items of this specific SKU in the cart to be simulated.

seller.description: The ID of the seller responsible for this SKU. This ID can be found in your VTEX Admin.

price.description: Item price within the context of the order without separating cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

bundleItems.description: Information on services sold along with the SKU. Example: a gift package.

price.description: Service price. The last two digits are the cents.

content.description: Content referring to the customization requested by the customer.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

isPercentual.description: `true` if price tag value is applied through a percentage.

value.description: Price tag value.

isGift.description: Indicates whether the order is a gift.

clientProfileData.description:
Customer's profile information. The `email` functions as a customer's ID.

For customers already in your database, sending only the email address is enough to register the order to the shoppers existing account.

> If the shopper exists in you database but is not logged in, sending other profile information along with the email will cause the platform to fail placing the order. This happens because this action is interpreted as an attempt to edit profile data, which is not possible unless the customer is logged in to the store.

documentType.description: Type of the document informed by the customer.

document.description: Document number informed by the customer.

corporateName.description: Company name, if the customer is a legal entity.

tradeName.description: Trade name, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporateDocument.description: Corporate document, if the customer is a legal entity.

stateInscription.description: State inscription, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporatePhone.description: Corporate phone number, if the customer is a legal entity.

isCorporate.description: `true` if the customer is a legal entity.

address.description:
Shipping address.

For customers already in your data base, it is enough to send this object only with an `addressId`, which you may obtain from a [Cart simulation request](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/shopping-cart#cartsimulation), for example.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`, among others.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

logisticsInfo.description: Array of objects containing logistics information of each item.

itemIndex.description: Index of the item in the `items` array, starting from 0.

shippingEstimate.description: Estimated time until delivery for the item.

price.description: Shipping price for the item. Does not account for the whole order's shipping price.

deliveryWindow.description: In case of scheduled delivery, this object will contain information on the delivery window selected by the shopper.

startDateUtc.description: Delivery window starting day and time in UTC.

endDateUtc.description: Delivery window ending day and time in UTC.

updateStatus.description: Indicate whether this object's information is up to date according to the order's items. An order can not be placed if `"outdated"`

giftCards.description: Gift card information, if it applies to the order.

value.description: Gift card value.

inUse.description: Indicates whether gift card is in use.

isSpecialCard.description: Indicates whether gift card is special.

requiresDocument.description: Indicates whether a document is required.

selected.description: Indicates whether this payment system has been selected.

referenceValue.description: Reference value for calculating interest rates, in case it applies.

value.description: Value including interest, in case it applies.

updateStatus.description: Indicates whether this object's information is up to date according to the order's items. An order can not be placed if `"outdated"`

coupon.description: Sending an existing coupon code in this field will return the corresponding discount in the purchase. Use the [cart simulation](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/orderform#orderformsimulation) request to check which coupons might apply before placing the order.

openTextField.description: Optional field meant to hold additional information about the order. We recommend using this field for text, not data formats such as `JSON` even if escaped. For that purpose, see [Creating customizable fields](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/creating-customizable-fields-in-the-cart-with-checkout-api-1)

salesAssociateId.description: Sales Associate (Seller) identification code. All information should be registered by the merchant. Maximum of 100 characters.

orderForm.description: This is `null` since this request does not depend on any previously existing orderForm information in the platform.

transactionData.description: Information on each transaction pertinent to the order placed.

transactionId.description: ID of the transaction in the platform.

merchantName.description: Name of the merchant responsible for the sale.

payments.description: Information on each payment pertinent to the transaction.

value.description: Total value to be paid in this payment.

referenceValue.description: Reference value over which interests may be applied.

gatewayCallbackTemplatePath.description: Template of the gateway callback path, which may later be used to send information about the transaction.

orders.description: Information on each of the orders created.

orderId.description: ID of the order in the Order Management System (OMS).

orderGroup.description: Order group. Orders that involve different sellers are split into different orders of a same order group.

isCheckedIn.description: Indicates whether order is checked in.

sellerOrderId.description: ID of the order in the seller.

value.description: Value of the order.

items.description: Information on each item in the order.

manualPriceAppliedBy.description: User that applied the manual price, if that is the case.

sellingPrice.description: Selling price in cents. Note that this field may be subject to rounding discrepancies. We recommend retrieving data from the `priceDefinition` data structure instead.

isGift.description: Indicates whether item is a gift.

productCategories.description: Object, where each field is an ID from `productCategoryIds`.

{ID}.description: Product category corresponding to the ID in the field key.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/pt/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

items.description: Seller.

bundleItems.description: Information on services sold along with the SKU. Example: a gift package.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

isPercentual.description: Indicates whether price tag value is applied through a percentage.

value.description: Price tag value.

priceDefinition.description: Price information for all units of a specific item.

calculatedSellingPrice.description: Item's calculated unitary selling price in cents.

total.description: Total value for all units of the item in cents.

sellingPrices.description: Array of objects, each containing value (in cents) and quantity for the different rounding instances that can be combined to form the correctly rounded total.

value.description: Value in cents for that specific rounding.

quantity.description: Rounding quantity, meaning how many items are rounded to this value.

value.description: Total value.

documentType.description: Type of the document informed by the customer.

corporateName.description: Company name, if the customer is a legal entity.

tradeName.description: Trade name, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporateDocument.description: Corporate document, if the customer is a legal entity.

stateInscription.description: State inscription, if the customer is a legal entity.

corporatePhone.description: Corporate phone number, if the customer is a legal entity.

isCorporate.description: Indicates whether the customer is a legal entity.

profileCompleteOnLoading.description: Indicates whether profile is complete on loading.

profileErrorOnLoading.description: Indicates whether profile presents error on loading.

ratesAndBenefitsData.description: Information on rates and benefits that apply to the order.

rateAndBenefitsIdentifiers.description: List with rates and benefits identifiers.

teaser.description: List with rates and benefits teasers.

shippingData.description: Shipping information pertinent to the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

logisticsInfo.description: Array with logistics information. Each object in this array corresponds to an object in the `items` array, based on the respective `itemIndex`.

itemIndex.description: Index corresponding to the position of the object in the `items` array.

selectedDeliveryChannel.description: Delivery channel selected by the customer.

shippingEstimate.description: Shipping estimate. For instance, Three business days will be represented `3bd`.

isPickupStore.description: Indicates whether it is the pickup store.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

transitTime.description: Transit time. For instance, "three business days" is represented `3bd`.

shipsTo.description: List of countries that the item may be shipped to.

items.description: Three letter country code.

selectedAddresses.description: Array with information on the selected addresses for the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

availableAddresses.description: Array with information on the available addresses for the order.

addressType.description: Type of address. For example, `Residential` or `Pickup`.

receiverName.description: Name of the person who is going to receive the order.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

number.description: Number of the building, house or apartment in the shipping address.

complement.description: Complement to the shipping address, in case it applies.

reference.description: Complement that might help locate the shipping address more precisely in case of delivery.

geoCoordinates.description: Array with two strings with geocoordinates, first latitude, then longitude.

giftCards.description: Gift card information, if it applies to the order.

value.description: Gift card value in cents.

inUse.description: Indicates whether gift card is in use.

isSpecialCard.description: Indicates whether gift card is special.

transactions.description: Information on each transaction pertinent to the order.

referenceValue.description: Reference value for calculating interest rates, in case it applies. Displayed in cents.

value.description: Value including interest, in case it applies. Displayed in cents.

items.description: List of objects containing metadata on each item in the order.

allowChangeSeller.description: Indicates whether seller changing is allowed.

isUserDataVisible.description: Indicates whether user data is visible.

post.description:
Order processing callback request, which is made after an order's payment is approved.

> This request has to be made until five minutes after the [Place order](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/order-placement-1#placeorder) or [Place order from existing cart](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/order-placement-1#placeorderfromexistingorderform) request has beem made, or else, the order will not be processed.

parameters.name: orderGroup
parameters.description: Order group. It is the part of the `orderId` that comes before the `-`. For example, the `orderGroup` of the order `123456789-01` is `123456789`.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: Cookie
parameters.description: VTEX Chekout cookie associated with a specific order. Use the `Vtex_CHKO_Auth` and the `CheckoutDataAccess` cookies returned by the [Place order](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/order-placement-1#placeorder) or [Place order from existing cart](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/order-placement-1#placeorderfromexistingorderform) API requests, like a browser would.

error.message: Seu pagamento no foi autorizado. Falha ao enviar os dados de pagamento. Favor entrar em contato com o SAC ou utilizar outra forma de pagamento. ***

get.description: Retrieve a list of sellers that cater to a specific region, according to your set up of our [regionalization feature](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/setting-up-price-and-availability-of-skus-by-region--12ne58BmvYsYuGsimmugoc#). Learn more about [Region v2](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/changelog/region-v2).

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Type of the content being sent.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

parameters.name: regionId
parameters.description: ID of the region corresponding to the shopper's location.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Three letter country code according to [ISO 3166-1 alpha 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3).

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: Postal code.

parameters.name: sc
parameters.description: Sales channel ID.

parameters.name: desiredSellerType
parameters.description: Desired seller type. Possible values are: `"All"`, `"Default"` or `"Whitelabel"`, which is the default.

sellers.description: Array with information on each seller retrieved for the given region.

items.description: Array containing information about the SKUs inside the cart to be simulated.

quantity.description: The quantity of items of this specific SKU in the cart to be simulated.

seller.description: The ID of the seller responsible for this SKU. This ID can be found in your VTEX Admin.

price.description: The new price of the item.

value.description: The value you want to set to the specified field.

appId.description: Custom data ID sent to the tax system.

fields.description: Array of fields available to the app.

allowMultipleDeliveries.description: On the same purchase, allows the selection of items from multiple delivery channels.

allowManualPrice.description: Allows the editing of SKU prices right in the cart.

maxNumberOfWhiteLabelSellers.description: Allows the input of a limit of white label sellers involved on the cart.

maskFirstPurchaseData.description: Allows, on a first purchase, masking client's data. It could be useful when a shared cart is used and the client doesn't want to share its data.

recaptchaValidation.description:
Configures reCAPTCHA validation for the account, defining in which situations the shopper will be prompted to validate a purchase with reCAPTCHA. Learn more about [reCAPTCHA validation for VTEX stores](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/recaptcha-no-checkout--18Te3oDd7f4qcjKu9jhNzP)

Possible values are:
- `"never"`: no purchases are validated with reCAPTCHA.
- `"always"`: every purchase is validated with reCAPTCHA.
- `"vtexCriteria"`: only some purchases are validated with reCAPTCHA in order to minimize friction and improve shopping experience. VTEXs algorithm determines which sessions are trustworthy and which should be validated with reCAPTCHA. This is the recommended option.

paymentSystemToCheckFirstInstallment.description: If you want to apply a first installment discount to a particular payment system, set this field to that payment system's ID. Learn more: [Configuring a discount for orders prepaid in full](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/configurar-desconto-de-preco-a-vista--7Lfcj9Wb5dpYfA2gKkACIt).

requiresAuthenticationForPreAuthorizedPa.description: Determines whether pre-authorized payments require authentication

allowInstallmentsMerge.description: By default (when `false`), on a multi-seller purchase is on the run, a simple intersection with installments options configured by every seller will be available. When `true`, this option allows a more complex but flexible installment option, since it considers max installments of every seller configuration, even if those don't match. Installment values may not be equal in this case.

waitingTime.description: Number of days after order cancelation by a seller, during which another seller may be assigned to fulfill the order.
